page.title: 05HEALTH-RIDING FOR DISABLED
page.content: The R.D.A. is an association which helps disabled people to learn how to ride horses. In Coity there is a group which is run by Mrs. Ladbrooke at Long Acre Farm. The age range from nine up to twenty two. They own 8 ponies and 56 acres of land and have 8 unpaid helpers. 56 disabled people come to the riding school a week. Their lessons last an hour. Some people are able to get on the horse by themselves, others have to be lifted on. The R.D.A. get money by raffles, or people give them money from jumble sales etc. Rags, the Blue Peter pony is ridden by everyone. The R.D.A. school is open all year round. Once a year six young handicapped people have a week's holiday at the riding school.
